title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (Representations of the mystery) There was something undefined and complete, coming into existence before Heaven and Earth.

passages.zh: 寂兮寥兮，獨立不改，周行而不殆，可以為天下母。
passages.en: How still it was and formless, standing alone, and undergoing no change, reaching everywhere and in no danger (of being exhausted)! It may be regarded as the Mother of all things.

passages.zh: 吾不知其名，字之曰道，強為之名曰大。
passages.en: I do not know its name, and I give it the designation of the Dao (the Way or Course). Making an effort (further) to give it a name I call it The Great.
Great, it passes on (in constant flow). Passing on, it becomes remote. Having become remote, it returns.

passages.zh: 故道大，天大，地大，王亦大。
passages.en: Therefore the Dao is great; Heaven is great; Earth is great; and the (sage) king is also great.

passages.zh: 域中有四大，而王居其一焉。
passages.en: In the universe there are four that are great, and the (sage) king is one of them.

passages.zh: 人法地，地法天，天法道，道法自然。
passages.en: Man takes his law from the Earth; the Earth takes its law from Heaven; Heaven takes its law from the Dao. The law of the Dao is its being what it is.
